Articles.Content: Welcome Back, Sir! Many of us were secretly hoping that you absence involved collaborating with SQUAD to help them make clouds in 1.0 (LOL). Wishful thinking! In any case, glad you got a little break. Don't let it overtake the things in life that are REALLY important.

Rbray is back... So my day is made. My week... No my month. Is made. Lol. Welcome back Rbray and good timing to boot with 1.0 around the corner.

I too often find hobbies can easily start to feel like jobs. Because you do get obsessed. And you soon get burnt out to the point where even the thought of your once loved hobby makes you sick.

The best thing for it is exactly what you did Rbray and that is to simply stop. And take a break only to hope one day that spark that made you fall in love with the hobby ignites again.

I can speak for the entire community when I say Im glad you found that spark again. Just make sure you take the time to actually PLAY the game. Do whatever it is you have to do to keep it fresh.

PS: Is it weird that I got as giddy as a school girl at a Bieber concert when I saw last post by rbray? Probably a little weird. Oh well. I don't care.

Hate to be just another +1, but I started this game during a steam sale last xmas. I never saw you around RB during my start, but your work was everywhere. I kept hear about EVE and whatnot. Finally looked it up and now i couldn't see my game without it. Kerbin feels naked and cold with no clouds/etc. Thank for the work you have done and I hope as all the others have that this round goes easier for you and you don't get overwhelmed. Long live EVE!

So... I'm back.

I want to first apologize to anyone/everyone about disappearing like that. I don't handle pressure well, and after getting so much attention from my mods it started to overwhelm me. I had to take a break, and the only way I could stop thinking about it was to get away. This was supposed to be a relaxing hobby, but turned into something like an obsession. Hopefully I'll manage better this time around. Don't be too surprised if you don't see much of me aside from once or twice a week as I try to keep things balanced.

I uploaded a new version on Github today... It is a new atmospheric model, and it should have (nearly) all the params needed to tune the atmosphere to perfection. Some things I have not implemented or tuned fully myself (few more params to come, along with scattering and sunsets), and I plan to make a few more improvements to the clouds, ocean and terrain. The new version of Unity is fantastic in that I can actually use the depth buffer (unity 5 acts like pro for everyone. They just changed the licensing terms) so it allows me to test and debug the shaders MUCH faster than I had ever been able to in the past.

Thank you all for the support and your well-wishes. Now Lets make KSP beautiful.

P.S. You can reach me over in reddit as waka324.

P.P.S I've been aiding blacktrack whenever I can with their new scatter mod. It is absolutely gorgeous, and honestly, that is what I was hoping for with this atmosphere model.

Great to see you back man!
rbray89, best wishes for RL stress, and best wishes for dealing well (and minimizing!) KSP stress; indeed it should be a pleasure not a stress. Cheers.

Does this mean I have yet more things to make my KSP look pretty?

Oh good

In all seriousness.

My Bray, it's nice to see you back and may I say that you need to make sure that you stick to the limits you place upon yourself, this is after all, just a game.

I would also like to say at this juncture that I am new to these forums, as in posting/having an account etc, but have been playing KSP since 0.12 or something, a far time anyways.

My comments carry no weight, this I understand, but may I state as my point of view, that you and your compatriots (see below) are the reason, the only reason, that I continue to play and that I encourage my kids to play.

KSP without the likes of:

RBray

NathanKell

PingoPete

Proot and many, many others; would simply be another failed 'indie' game that never got developed right.

You guys, to my mind have made this game a) playable enjoyable c) viable.

This is not pressure, this is praise.

I work hard, doing a 'job' that is horrible with little to no thanks and a stress level that would make Superman cry and this is all put aside when I sit and play YOUR KSP.

I sit and look at the visuals YOU GUYS created, flying rockets and planes created by numerous modders, having fun with my kids, playing a game that a company get praise and plaudits for, but is made what it is my you and the rest of the modding community.

From the very bottom of my heart, I thank you and all your modding compatriots for putting in the time & effort that the rest of us benefit from.

Much love and appreciation

Ork
I love you too, Rbray! You've given such a powerful tool to the KSP community, and for that I am very grateful.
He's back! I'm super excited to see the overhaul get completed.

Yea...............

Greetings to Rbray.....

Welcome back and stay chilled....

and why not, a rasher of bacon for all........................
welcome back Rbay. Take your time and take small steps. I had something simmilar with other game. It started to be like 2nd work. So take your time and enjoy new release on Monday.

It's wonderful to have you back Rbray! Please take your time and don't stress over these projects. I burned myself out working on the Better Atmospheres pack so I know how it can go. I'm glad you are well and look forward to what the future brings.

Hey rbray, so just did some preliminary testing of your latest upload, unfortunately I ran into some problems. I tried it on RSS but got some unusual graphical glitches with no atmosphere appearing on earth in PQS & SS. I tried it on stock kerbin with no other mods, works in PQS but in SS got the same bizarre glitches. Still figuring out what the new density ratios represent, couldn't seem to figure which one increases ground haze. Btw I tried this on linux 64 bit and windows 64 and 32 seems to be persistent throughout though it could be something on my end.

P.s. hate to be the bringer of bad news but thought I'd let you know

Thanks again for the work time you're putting into this!

I know that feel, i somehow allways want to end things with "..."...

Its so good to see you back in the action, this hyped me more for 1.0 than the official stuff.

You like dots don't you...

It's a finger twitch....

Usually happens when I have not had enough bacon, chocolate and coffee....

But not in that... order....

I've tried the last version. Atmo seems to work right this time and looks better, imho. But still fades out when you turn to the night side. You know, like a disappearing effect. Oh, and oceans remains transparent in the horizon.

For the rest all seems pretty well for me.
Welcome back, glad to hear you are working with blackrack, the scattering is lovely and the water is great too, I just miss your clouds ;(

Yeah, the parameters need to be mucked around with a bit. I'll probably end up altering/simplifying the equation though for performance depending on what 1.0 performance is like.

EDIT: The real issue I think however, is that the formula is modeled around ACTUAL pressure models, which may not necessarily translate to "Earth-like" results when scaled. I'd be curious to see what this looks like on RSS when the params are tuned (hint: set _Scale to 500/PlanetRadius)

Good news is that Scaled space is working as intended.
